Description: Fragments of papyri, joined together for bookbinding; traces of Coptic text on both sides: 8 lines clear with faint traces of a further 5 lines written along the fibres (recto), and faint traces of further Coptic text written against the fibres (verso). This may be writing from the recto of another papyrus, as what faint letters can be discerned seem to be backwards when viewed from the verso. EA 75337, 75336, 75335, 75334 are mounted together.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380759) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380759)
